name: Four Seasons Resort Marrakech

reviews.title: Four Seasons Marrakech: An Oasis
reviews.text: We loved our stay at this hotel. The staff (manager, junior manager, and concierge team) were all very welcoming and helpful throughout our stay. The rooms, grounds, and pools are beautiful, quiet, and relaxing. We enjoyed the fresh fruit placed in the room each day. We only ate at the hotel for breakfast, but the breakfast buffet was very good.

reviews.title: Marrakech - special for families
reviews.text: The hotel offers many interesting day trips outside Marrakech. We did a day trip to a Berber village in the Atlas mountains. There, we made tagine in the home of a villager and were given a tour of the village and a brief ride on a donkey. Learning about life in the village and spending time in someone's home was a very unique experience. One of the reasons we stayed at the Four Seasons was because this excursion is exclusive to the hotel because of their affiliation with the tour company. Our tour guide was a lovely woman who was very easy to talk to and very attentive to our questions and needs throughout the day.

reviews.title: Absolute Luxury and Top Notch Service
reviews.text: The concierge was helpful in arranging a last-minute excursion to ride camels in an area outside of the city.

reviews.title: This Hotel Will be Excellent
reviews.text: The concierge made recommendations and reservations at two excellent restaurants for dinner: Dar Al Yacout and Al Fassia.

reviews.title: Marvellous Marrakech
reviews.text: We went to the souks by ourselves one evening and did not have any problems.
We booked at Four Seasons Marrakech to attend a wedding in the city.
reviews.title: Excellent stay
Absolutely amazing - thank you !!
reviews.text: Our stay was simply perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel location is very convenient, 10 minutes from the airport and 10 minutes to the main attractions. Our room was spacious with all comfort you might need, matching Four Seasons quality standards.
reviews.title: Everything is very beautiful but lack of magic

reviews.text: Service was great with excellent staff from front desk to restaurants, nothing particular to say other than that it's very good. Pools are huge with comfortable lounge chairs and cabanas. Travelling with a 1 year old baby, we enjoyed the family pool and its great staff.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Great Service, I will go back

reviews.text: Spa is good with a relaxing atmosphere.
reviews.title: Opulent Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently druses at this property after recommendation from friend who works for the company.
reviews.title: Great new property

reviews.text: This is a great property in an amazing location. Certainly one of the nicest resorts in the world. Plus the food is great and very reasonable and the restaurants in town are great.
reviews.title: Great location far from the madding crowds, but not too far to enjoy.

reviews.text: This is a truely great place
reviews.title: Family weekend break

reviews.text: This is a lovely property, as you would expect from the Four Seasons. We arrived at night, which was lovely as they had lights on the palm trees along the drive. It was quite a chilly night but there was a lovely log fire alight in Reception. The rooms are really spacious with a walk in dressing room and lovely large bathroom. The bath was one of the best I have ever experience, really deep but didn't take long to fill. The beds were beautiful and quality of the linen exceptional. All rooms have a balcony with a couple of chairs and table and a cute little day bed area. One of the best things are the swimming pools - there is a large adult only one and also a large family pool, far enough away from each other to be peaceful. The spa was a welcome relief after sightseeing in the hectic Medina, which is only a short 10 minute taxi journey from the hotel. They also have a great kids club and dedicated pool just for this secure area.
reviews.title: Amazing service in a beautiful hotel

reviews.text: We are just back from a weekend in the FS Marrakech! We had a truly great relaxing break. The children thought they were famous as all the staff were on first name terms with them which they really loved. The kids club was second to none and the kids had a great time there begging to go back all the time. I had two slight problems during my stay firstly our room wasn't cleaned on the first day so when I returned at 5 to see it hadn't been done I was rather disappointed however they were quick to come and do it and brought us some complimentary drinks and everyone from the duty manager to the head of housekeeping called to apologies. Secondly I had to request a wine glass three time first 2 times I got brought various different items!! Overall though it was a very relaxing break which I really enjoyed and I would highly recommend this hotel especially if your travelling with children! They will be treated like royalty during their stay!
reviews.title: Very Close to Perfection
Relaxing Resort
reviews.text: This is a relatively new Four Seasons, and if you know the brand, you can rest assured that this resort now offers service which is now very close to other FS resorts world wide; in an ideal location.

reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel
reviews.text: The setting and the architecture are outstanding, the resort is small and has a perfect air of calm, similar to the FS in Chang Mai, for instance. On the other hand there are fewer activities than some of the busier resorts such as Punta Mita and Costa Rica. in fact there were no additional activities during our stay. That suited us, but may be not everyone.

reviews.title: Style and substance in Marrakech
reviews.text: Breakfast and food are excellent, but only cater to western tastes.

reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin
reviews.text: The adult pool was quiet, and finding shaded chairs was never a problem. Unusually for FS there is no pool service, though staff from the nearby restaurant will bring drinks, if you go and find them.

reviews.title: Great, but still some work to do
reviews.text: The staff are responsive, and quickly put right anything that was wrong. Guest should not hesitate to ask to speak to a manager if there is a problem, my experience throughout the FS group is that they will try to respond to any (reasonable) request.
I stayed in the Four Seasons Resort in Marrakech with my Mother and my 4 year old son during the month of October. Four Seasons took such great care of us and it was a really memorable holiday.
reviews.title: An amazing experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I advice you to hire the "Meet and greet" service, both for your arrival as for your departure. There is someone from the hotel waiting for you when you get off the plane, he escorts you to a VIP area while they take care of all your passport controls, and then take you directly to a comfy air conditioned Jeep (the taxis available at the airport arent excatly screaming comfort!)
reviews.title: Not Quite Ready Yet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once we arrived at the hotel it was like a dream, the decoration throughout and the gardens are maginificent. We were able to check in at the terrace whilst enjoying a cold drink, this was much appreciated. We booked an executive suite but as the hotel was not very full we received a complimentary upgrade. The rooms are decorated beautifully and from our room we had direct access to the family pool which was great.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: If travelling with kids this is a great place to stay, the family pool is fantastic for them to be able to have fun, without worrying about bothering those guests without children. They also have a great Kids Club program run by the wonderful Myriam.
reviews.title: Excellent Excellent

reviews.text: The food is so good, we ate lunch and dinner in the hotel everyday and it was a great mix of typical food from the area as well as classic bistro dishes. The menus for children are also great!
reviews.title: The best of best

reviews.text: Absolutely fabulous hotel/resort. Friendly staff, everyone we came across spoke English. Beautiful interior and exterior, attention to detail was obvious throughout. Return is a must and soon. The only downside is the distance to the Jemma el Fna square, about an hours walk.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not really knowing what a riad would be like or which one to chose we decided to play it safe and stayed at the Four Seasons in Marrakech. In retrospect this was a bad choice. The Four Seasons is about a 5-10 minute drive into the old town. In reality this is not a big problem and the hotel offers a courtesy car (albeit not always available) and a taxi only costs drms 50. However it does mean that you are less likely to make short trips into and out of town.
reviews.title: Mixed experience

reviews.text: A friend of ours works at the Four Seasons in London and let them know we were arriving. Apart from mentioning this in our welcome note this made no difference to our stay (which we really can't complain about). We booked a pavilion room as we wanted to overlook the pool and had read that these were the nicer rooms. We wish we had known to ask for a west facing room, as by the time we had returned from breakfast our terrace was in shade.
reviews.title: You must try the Spa and experience a Hamman.

reviews.text: We ate in Solano on our first night as we wanted to experience traditional Morrocan food without needing to go into town. There were only about two other tables occupied so it felt rather soulless. The food was ok but nothing to write home about. The tagine was not served with Morrocan bread but with rice which seemed odd. At £25 for a glass of champagne it felt less Morrocan all of a sudden! The breakfast in this restaurant is good with a plenty of choice.
reviews.title: pleasant but dissapointing

reviews.text: Our room was perfectly pleasant but unfortunately managed to get a negative score with one of my 'no nos' for 5 star hotels - a hairdryer which requires you to keep your finger pressed on it or it goes off, and no cold shot button! The internet connection was not strong and you sometimes had to move around the room to catch it.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Hotel with wonderful service
Fantastic
reviews.text: What a fantastic hotel. Stayed there on a BMW Motorrad product launch event and stayed at the Four Seasons for 3 days and what an positive experience. The service was the best I have ever experienced, the food was wonderful - exotic, Morrocan with an European touch.

reviews.title: Stunning design and excellent service
reviews.text: Spend a couple of afternoons by the pool and the service was absolute the best. The life guards and the waiters at the cafe were very attentive and kind. Brought clean and dry towels when we needed them (and even when we didn't need them), provided us with sun lotion, moved the parasols etc. - still without being overattentive.

reviews.title: Not what I expect from FS
reviews.text: Would really like to stay there again.

reviews.title: it is shame
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the FS Marrakech in September for 5 nights and had nothing short of an excellent stay. The hotel is beautiful. I was nervous because many reviews said that it was lacking in local design but I think it had the perfect touches of local flair. It was subtle but we tend to lean towards modern anyways. The architecture and landscaping was beautiful. The spa was also worth visiting. We stayed in a Pavilion Room and it was wonderful. They are in the free standing casitas if you will overlooking the resort. Next time I would try the Pavilion suite which was below our room but had a plunge pool. The service was phenomenal from the pool person to the individual in charge of creating experiences. She helped me plan an unforgettable afternoon for my husband's birthday. I would definitely recommend the hotel to couples, singles looking for some R&R and families. In fact the family pool was possibly more stunning than the adult pool! Worth the trekk to Marrakech. Well done Four Seasons.

reviews.title: A peaceful haven in a sea of madness
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel situated close to town, not that you really want to leave. Fabulous room with lovely view. We were here with BMW for a conference and the food was terrible, boring and to be honest in edible.

reviews.title: Ideal base for Marrakech with kids
reviews.text: Having spent more than a decade in Asia, I dare to say that the level of quality and luxury at the 4 Seasons and other super lux resorts in Marrakech is at a higher level than the best in Asia.

reviews.title: perfect resort, fantastic staff a memorable experience
reviews.text: For our trip, the 4Seasons was an outstanding blend of luxury, location and style. An absolute must stay if you have children who will need a break from souks, medina and general intensity of Marrakech.

reviews.title: An oasis of elegance, charm and confort
reviews.text: It's rare that I can find nothing wrong with a hotel/resort, but this time I am stumped.

reviews.title: An oasis from the chaos of the Medina
reviews.text: perfect resort, fantastic staff a memorable experience. The staff cant do enough for you. The room was spotless with a great terrace and a truly wonderful bathroom. The spa treatments were first class and they did everything to accomodate us and move bookings from the sunday to the saturday as it was raining on the saturday afternoon. The gym is probably one of the best i have come across in hotels of this standing and i would highly recommend the new bar which opened the day we arrived above the italian restaurant. The resort is not cheap but certainly get what you pay for in every sense

reviews.title: There is probably nothing better for the familes
reviews.text: I went to this new hotel in Marrakech for the first time to participate in an international investment conference and I was simply charmed by the quality and beauty of the place. Superb architecture, lovely deign, excellent service and most efficient inference logistics. A most pleasant and delightful stay. Will certainly come back

description: Marrakech refreshed: Located adjacent to the Menara Gardens, just a five minute drive from the exotic energy of the ancient Medina, Four Seasons offers a fresh Moroccan perspective: a calming resort-hotel with a light Moroccan touch. The inspiring retreat combines an impressive spa, landscaped pools, gardens and event space with a contemporary design that augments the sense of airy luminosity. Welcoming and uplifting, the hotel offers couples, families and groups a stylish oasis within an intriguing ancient city.
